comments.commentBody:
This is the problem with LinkedIn. The lawsuit is long overdue.

It should be a crime for any 3rd party to access, retrieve or install information on our computers without our full knowledge and without our full permission.

LinkedIn's deception and trickery is not only annoying, it should be unlawful.

ACA is not a license to steal and thus not desired by the interests desiring to nip it in the bud.

We put ourselves at a disadvantage by not having a national health care system, not having updated infrastructure and with the aid of the bought and paid for members of congress we did not get the perfect ACA, but it is better than the alternative and can be perfected. The Free Men is just a slogan pushed by Koch and Ilk to take our eye off the prize which is to be rid of lobbyists and get back to representative government. Free markets where the fix is in. Hardly.. we're being conned by Fox and friends.

We've seen medical delivery that works in Europe and Canada and even the Far East. Time to tell the Free folk to go where they park their money to avoid taxes.. hint, hint the politicians cost less!

I am one of the millions who loved 'Eat, Pray, Love.'  Kudos to Elizabeth Gilbert for touching so many with her writing, and hearty congratulations and best wishes for her many and continued successes.

@Stu: Without the return of Soriano to provide lineup protection for Cano, the Yankees are barely better than the Jays and would have been long eliminated from playoff contention. Soriano has 17 HR for the Yankee$ in 53 games after having 17 in 93 games for the Cubs.
The only way the Yankee$ can sign Cano while *also* staying under the $189M salary threshold in order to zero out luxury tax And revenue sharing is if A-Roid is suspended and his salary doesn't count for next year. So Selig will provide material help to the Yankee$' cause by suspending A-Roid. How nice for them. Even if they sign Cano, who's going to pitch as $abathia is the only pitcher signed for next year?

Sorry Stu but the AL MVP this year is Dustin Pedroia. Gold glove defense, held the lineup together batting third most of the year (thus responsible for our steroid abuser, Ortiz, having a productive year), and played hurt the entire season. He also started the beard thing several years ago, which gave the Red Sox a rallying point.

And we signed him for half of what you'll overpay for Cano.

If I was Yankee management I would stress that they viewed Cano as a career Yankee and tell Cano and his people that an A-Rod kind of contract was a mistake, that no player is worth that, and try to get him to sign for $20 million. The difficult part is that the Yankees really need Cano and his people likely know this. And the Yankees might end of giving Cano just that, A-Rod's $25, million. A five year contract would be best for the Yankees, but Cano might push for eight.

They may have to spend far more on his contract than they would have hoped but the Yanks absolutely have to sign Cano now.  He's been the one constant on the staff this year and, insofar as I'm concerned, should rank third in the MVP voting , behind only Cabrera and Chris Davis.  Would this team have had ANY chance of contending without him?

["“I am sorry I’m late,” Nancy Pelosi murmured sardonically, as she arrived at the Buffett event. “We were busy taking food out of the mouths of babies.”] [Dowd]

Yes, that's what Boehner was asking the House to do.

Hope Nancy gets to be the next Speaker, after the Tea Party jilts Boehner.

My kind of humour, Migrant. Feeling fine now.

Don't forget to tell those little inmates about the elephant in your pajamas.

Licorice Whips.

They are a variety of ways that they likely are generating the 'people you might know list,' but it would be more transparent to tell people.

And I do know several not -so-tech savvy folks who didn't realize what exactly they were doing with the 'import' function and were chagrined when they realized that essentially they'd spammed everyone in their email address book. This was a couple of years ago.

LinkedIn is better than the FB , but they should all work on being much more transparent and doing more confirming/explaining impact of user actions before implementing them. It is pretty clear at this juncture that folks don't really understand the ramifications of many social media actions that they take, whether they are 13, 30, or three score years old.

The same has happened to me.  I was curious as to how these "connections" were recommended.  It seemed at the time these connections came from my e-mail account but blew it off as being coincidental, maybe we shared a few key words in our profiles. Now I see my initial conclusion was the right one.
Isn't it possible that LinkedIn knows about those people you might know because it has properly accessed *their* contacts, and your name showed up there?

I will be calling the law firm suing linkedin monday morning to add my name as a plaintiff/witness.

When I joined linkedin, I NEVER agreed to give them ANY names in my MS Outlook contact list, but when I log into the sight, they list people who I've emailed from Outlook and exist in my Outlook contacts as "People I May Know." The only possible way they could have gotten these names and associated them with me is to have hacked into my contacts and emails, I never authorized them to do so - I confirmed this by checking on the linkedin site and there were no contacts imported there - so by definition the only way linkedin could have made the connection between me and the people listed would have been to surreptitiously hacked in.

Besides grabbing emails, names in emails, and contacts from my outlook files, did linkedin also steal personal data appearing in the "notes" section of each contact that I store for my clients? If this is not a federal crime, I do not know what is - I am livid, and wish that linkedin is literally put out of business for doing this.

The Catholic church has many faults, but your comment about denying science sounds like a rant against fundamentalists, not a knowledgeable critique of church teachings. For example, the Catholic church embraces evolution, it simply places god as the initiating force. Some of the most astute scholars and seekers on the planet are Jesuits. Yes, the church has hair-brained ideas, such as a celibate priesthood, anti gay prejudice, addled support for unbridled procreation, the belief in a fairy godfather, etc, but do not mistake the Catholics for fundamentalists.

It is still the church. Their best asset helping the poor, while encouraging the poor to procreate, more  than they and their counties can  support, and often when the governments are unwilling to help the poor. The church works to have the  impovished populations grow so they can have more followers. The church that encourages people to deny science. The church that asks its followers to devote themselves to  fantacy instead of knowledge.  The nee Pope might be better but it is still the  church.

I presume you are referring to the shooting in Chicago? Of course, this is tragic but to claim this a a global tragedy is a very US-centric  view. Almost 100 people were killed in suicide bombings in Iraq yesterday. 72 were killed in Pakistan today. 13 people being injured in Chicago is terrible, but there are much, much worse things happening in the world. The loss of life in these places is no less important just because it occurs so frequently and the victims are not wealthy.

Mr. Hicks, thank you for your professional persistence, and your bravery, and also that of your wife's as well.  How terrible to have two such mass tragedies within the same week in the world:  U.S., and now Nairobi.  Such carnage on innocents, for what?  I feel so sad, and my heart goes out to each family who has lost a loved one, or who has an injured loved one.  So terribly, awfully sorry.
Al-Shabaab, a terrorist organization of jihadist Sunni Muslims is "thanking" Kenya for their support of the Somali government's fight against other jihadists, Boko Haram.
Sorry to see this shooting and feel for people who are just going about their day. I'll never understand why  there is no regard for life.
Incredible reporting!!

Thank you for these searing photos.
Stay safe and keep your lenses clean!

Witnesses to horror are needed, no matter how disgusting or frightening the images.  Without visual witness, humans all too easily forget or pass by to the next silly celebrity scandal.  Thank you for the images, including especially the one with military crouched next to a poster for a dystopian futuristic film starring Matt Damon.  The false future meets the true present, and it is too close to similar for comfort.
A year not over. Brave man.
Mr. Garren, would you be willing to visit individuals who are ill and explain to them that a 6-month "cooling off period" before they get health insurance would be a great idea?

This theory must also apply to the cost of colleges with luxury accommodations and all you can eat top-buck buffets for all meals not contributing to the exhorbitant costs.  Just north of Des Moines, in Mankato, Minn.  the State College System imploded two, 20 year old high rise dorms this summer because they were not good enough for today's students.  I suppose this waste is to be considered trivial in comparison with other college costs   -  NOT.

New Yorkers are used to older run down hospitals. Come out to the hinterlands - the costs  are far lower and the amenities far greater. Two people in a room?  That sounds like the 1950's.  Then again I forget that the writers for the NYT rarely venture west of the Hudson and when they do they consider the natives to be rubes. The costs of running a hospital are almost always the staff and not the structure.

Stay safe. You inspire and amaze me as a photographer. I've been blogging about your day:
http://www.timkellerphotography.com/BlogsTKP/2013/SeptOct.html#TylerHicks
Good, timely work

Thanks for the story, amazing personal account of a tragic event.

So what happened in the end? Did they capture the gunmen?
Wow, much respect Tyler! Great work!
Yes.....thank you for all your courage and determination, risking your life as a part of your work . I hope you stay safe!
Mr. Hicks: Two weeks after the happiest day of your life, surely today was one of the most horrific. Thank you for your bravery and bearing witness to this terrible act of terror.
He lives in Nairobi.
What are the chances Tyler Hicks would be there... thats CRAZY.   Thank goodness your OK and thanks again for your bravery!
Very sad and disturbing.

What a horrible act, my heart truly goes out to the families of those who lost their lives and were injured.  I cannot imagine myself or loved ones in that situation, I'm glad to hear that Tyler is safe, thank you for stepping up and please continue to stay safe.
